text: {{ infobox writer | name = Jan Kerouac | image = Jan Kerouac 1983.jpg | imagesize = | alt = | caption = Jan Kerouac in Eugene, Oregon (1983) | pseudonym = | birth_name = Janet Michelle Kerouac | birth_date = | birth_place = Albany, New York, U.S. | death_date = | death_place = Albuquerque, New Mexico, U.S. | resting_place = Saint Louis De Gonzague Cemetery | occupation = Writer | language = | nationality = American | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = | alma_mater = | period = | genre = | subject = | movement = | notableworks = | spouses = | partners = | children = | relatives = Jack Kerouac Joan Haverty Kerouac | influences = | influenced = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | website = | portaldisp = }} Jan-Michelle Kerouac (born February 16, 1952 - died June 7, 1996) was the daughter of writer Jack Kerouac, by his second wife Joan Haverty. A writer herself, Jan's books included Baby Driver and Trainsong. She also appeared in some documentary programs about her father, giving her side of his life story. ==Death== On June 5, 1996, Kerouac died in Albuquerque, New Mexico a day after her spleen was removed. She had suffered kidney failure five years earlier and was on dialysis. She is buried in Nashua, New Hampshire, next to her father's parents. ==References== ==Other websites== *Jan Kerouac Obituary *New York Times story Category:1952 births Category:1996 deaths Category:Writers from New York (state)
title: Jan Kerouac
